intro: Monnina pseudostipulata, commonly known as the false stipule monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters, and are borne on short pedicels. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
